tech.mcprison.prison.util

Class Text

  • java.lang.Object
    • tech.mcprison.prison.util.Text

  • public class Text
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides utilities for manipulating text.
    Since:
    API 1.0

    • Method Detail

      • explodeRegex

        public static java.lang.String[] explodeRegex(java.lang.String text,
                                              java.lang.String delimiter)
        Splits a string at a delimiter. The delimiter may include regular expressions to assist in splitting.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to split.
        delimiter - The delimiter to split at, which may contain regular expressions.
        Returns:
        The array of strings, split at the delimiter. The delimiter is not included in any of the entries.

      • explode

        public static java.lang.String[] explode(java.lang.String text,
                                         java.lang.String delimiter)
        Splits a string at a delimiter. Any RegEx characters found in the delimiter string will be ignored, which is useful in many cases.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to split.
        delimiter - The delimiter to split at, with any the regular expression characters ignored.
        Returns:
        The array of strings, split at the delimiter. The delimiter is not included in any of the entries.

      • replaceLastRegex

        public static java.lang.String replaceLastRegex(java.lang.String text,
                                                java.lang.String regex,
                                                java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces the last occurrence of a String delimiter, found by a regular expression, with a replacement string.
        Parameters:
        text - The text.
        regex - The regular expression, which is used to find the last occurrence.
        replacement - The replacement string.
        Returns:
        The string, with the last occurrence replaced.

      • replaceLast

        public static java.lang.String replaceLast(java.lang.String text,
                                           java.lang.String toReplace,
                                           java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces the last occurrence of a String delimiter. Regular expressions will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        text - The text.
        toReplace - The text to find the last occurrence of, and replace.
        replacement - The replacement string.
        Returns:
        The string, with the last occurrence replaced.

      • translateColorCodes

        public static java.lang.String translateColorCodes(java.lang.String text,
                                                   char prefix)
        Translates the color codes (a-f) (A-F) (0-9), prefixed by a certain character, into Minecraft-readable color codes.

        Use of this method is discouraged. Implementations are recommended to translate color codes using their native internal's APIs. This assumes that the server mod will accept vanilla Minecraft color codes, although implementations such as Sponge do not do this. However, because there are some practical uses for a method like this, it exists in a non-deprecated but discouraged state.

        Parameters:
        text - The text to translate color codes in.
        prefix - The color code prefix, which comes before the color codes.
        Returns:
        The translated string.

      • translateAmpColorCodes

        public static java.lang.String translateAmpColorCodes(java.lang.String text)
        Translates color codes (a-f) (A-F) (0-9), prefixed by an ampersand, into Minecraft-readable color codes.

        Use of this method is discouraged. Implementations are recommended to translate color codes using their native internal's APIs. This assumes that the server mod will accept vanilla Minecraft color codes, although implementations such as Sponge do not do this. However, because there are some practical uses for a method like this, it exists in a non-deprecated but discouraged state.

        Parameters:
        text - The text to translate.
        Returns:
        The translated string.
        See Also:
        translateColorCodes(String, char)

      • stripColor

        public static java.lang.String stripColor(java.lang.String text)
        Strips the given message of all color codes
        Parameters:
        text - String to strip of color.
        Returns:
        A copy of the input string, without any coloring.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The formatted string.
        See Also:
        NumberFormat.getCurrencyInstance(Locale)

      • getTimeUntilString

        public static java.lang.String getTimeUntilString(long millis)
        Takes a millisecond amount and converts it into a pretty, human-readable string.
        Parameters:
        millis - The time until (or since if this is negative) something occurs.
        Returns:
        The human-readable string.

      • pluralize

        public static java.lang.String pluralize(java.lang.String baseNoun,
                                         int quantity)
        Makes a base noun plural, depending on the quantity. For example, entering "thing" as the base noun would make it "things", if the quantity exceeds one.
        Parameters:
        baseNoun - The non-plural base noun. Example: "thing"
        quantity - The amount.
        Returns:
        The pluralized string.
